intro: Lidbeckia turbinata, commonly known as the Turban Buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking, yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. Lidbeckia turbinata is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
